intro: Trichotosia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, compound umbels of small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as forest understories or stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often emitting a subtle, spicy scent. Trichotosia uniflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological niche.
